English Translation: Vaishampayana said: When that best of monkeys had gone away, that foremost of powerful men Bhima, went by that way over the extensive Gandhamadana.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तरुणादित्यसंकाशश्चीरवासा जटाधरः। पद्मपत्राननः पिङ्गस्तेजसा प्रज्वलन्निव॥
English Translation: He went on, reflecting on Hanumana's body and effulgence which were matchless on earth and also the greatness and dignity of Dasharatha's son.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: उपसृष्टं तु तं कृष्णौ भ्राजमानं द्विजोत्तमम्। अर्जुनो वासुदेवश्च तूर्णमुत्पत्य तस्थतुः॥
English Translation: Going in search of the place where grew the lotuses (in question), Bhima saw romantic forests, groves, rivers, lakes, trees adorned with blossoms and sylvan wood-lands beautified by various flowers.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: वैशम्पायन उवाच प्रयान्तं देवकीपुत्रं परवीररुजो दश। महारथा महाबाहुमन्वयुः शस्त्रपाणयः॥
English Translation: O descendant of Bharata, he saw herds of mad elephants besmeared with mud. They looked like masses of clouds pouring rains.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: पदातीनां सहस्रं च सादिनां च परंतप। भोज्यं च विपुलं राजन् प्रेष्याच शतशोऽपरे॥
English Translation: When proceeding quickly, that handsome hero saw in the forest, deer of quick glances with grass in their mouth standing along with their mates.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: जनमेजय उवाच कथं प्रयातो दाशार्हो महात्मा मधुसूदनः। कानि वा व्रजतस्तस्य निमित्तानि महौजसः॥
English Translation: Bhimasena, fearless from his great prowess, went into that hilly region inhabited by the buffaloes, bears and leopards, as if he had been invited by the forest-trees, shaken by the breeze, ever fragrant with flowers and bearing beautiful copper-coloured twigs. He passed by lakes, each having romantic descents and woods, adorned with lotuses and lilies, which were swarıned with maddened black bees. On account of the presence of the lotus-buds, they appeared as if they had joined hands (before Bhima).
---
Sanskrit Shloka: वैशम्पायन उवाच तस्य प्रयाणे यान्यासन् निमित्तानि महात्मनः। तानि मे शृणु सर्वाणि दैवान्यौत्यातिकानि च॥
English Translation: Having for his provisions, on the way, the words of Draupadi, Bhima proceeded on with great speed, keeping his mind and eyes fixed on the charming slopes of the mountain.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अनभ्रेऽशनिनिर्घोषः सविद्युत् समजायत। अन्वगेव च पर्जन्यः प्रावर्षद् विघने भृशम्॥
English Translation: When the time of noon had passed away, he saw the forest scattered over by deer and also by a great river full of fresh golden lotuses.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्रत्यगूहुर्महानद्यः प्राङ्मुखाः सिन्धुसप्तमाः। विपरीता दिश: सर्वा न प्राज्ञायत किंचन॥
English Translation: Swarmed with swans and Karandavas and adorned with Chakravakas, it (the river) appeared like a garland of pure lotuses worn by the mountain.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्राज्वलन्नग्नयो राजन् पृथिवी समकम्पत। उदपानाश्च कुम्भाश्च प्रासिञ्चञ्छतशो जलम्॥
English Translation: That greatly powerful hero saw, there, the great Sugandhika forest, delightful and effulgent as the sun.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तमः संवृतमप्यासीत् सर्वं जगदिदं तथा। न दिशो नादिशो राजन् प्रज्ञायन्ते स्म रेणुना॥
English Translation: Seeing it, the son of Pandu (Bhima) thought in his mind that his object had been fulfilled. He also mentally presented himself before his beloved (Draupadi) worn out by exile.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्रादुरासीन्महाञ्छब्दः खे शरीरंदृशयते। सर्वेषु राजन् देशेषु तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥
English Translation: Lomasha said: You have seen many mountains and rivers, towns and forests and also many charming Tirthas, the sacred water of which you have touched with your hands.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्रामथ्नाद्धास्तिनपुरं वातो दक्षिणपश्चिमः। आरुजन् गणशो वृक्षान् परुषोऽशनिनिस्वनः॥
English Translation: O sons of Pandu, this way leads to the celestials Mandara mountain; therefore be attentive and free from all anxieties.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: यत्र यत्र च वार्ष्णेयो वर्तते पथि भारत। तत्र तत्र सुखो वायुः सर्वं चासीत् प्रदक्षिणम्॥
English Translation: You will now go to the abode of the celestials Rishis of virtuous deeds.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: ववर्ष पुष्पवर्षं च कमलानि च भूरिशः। समश्च पन्था निर्दुःखो व्यपेतकुशकण्टकः॥
English Translation: O king, here flows the great and beautiful river (Alakananda) of sacred water rising from the Badari tree. It is ever adored by the celestials Rishis,
---
Sanskrit Shloka: संस्तुतो ब्राह्मणैर्गीर्भिस्तत्र तत्र सहस्रशः। अर्च्यते मधुपश्च वसुभिश्च वसुप्रदः॥
English Translation: It is always adored by the high-souled. Vaihayasa, Valakhilyas and the Gandharvas,
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तं किरन्ति महात्मानं वन्यैः पुष्पैः सुगन्धिभिः। स्त्रियः पथि समागम्य सर्वभूतहिते रतम्॥
English Translation: And the singers of the Sama (Veda) the Rishis, Marichi, Pulaha, Bhrigu and Angirasa chant the hymns in this place.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: स शालिभवनं रम्यं सर्वसस्यसमाचितम्। सुखं परमर्मिष्ठमभ्यगाद् भरतर्षभ॥
English Translation: Here does the lord of the celestials with the Marutas perform his daily prayers. The Siddhas and the Ashvins wait upon him.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: पश्यन् बहुपशून् ग्रामान् रम्यान् हृदयतोषणान्। पुराणि च व्यतिक्रामन् राष्ट्राणि विविधानि च॥
English Translation: The moon with the sun and with all the luminaries and with the planets always go to this river by day and by night.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: नित्यं हृष्टाः सुमनसो भारतैरभिरक्षिताः। नोद्विग्नाः परचक्राणां व्यसनानामकोविदाः॥ उपप्लव्यादथागम्य जनाः पुरनिवासिनः। पथ्यतिष्ठन्त सहिता विष्वक्सेनदिदृक्षया॥
English Translation: O greatly blessed one, that protector of the world, Vrishanka (Shiva) received on his head the all of the waters of this river at the source of the Ganges.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: ते तु सर्वे समायान्तमग्निमिद्धमिव प्रभुम्। अर्चयामासुरर्चाहँ देशातिथिमुपस्थितम्॥
English Translation: O child, now come to this goddess of six attributes and bow down before her with concentrated mind.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: वृकस्थलं समासाद्य केशवः परवीरहा। प्रकीर्णरश्मावादित्ये व्योम्नि वै होहितायति॥
English Translation: Vaishampayana said : Having heard the words of the illustrious Lomasha the Pandavas reverentially worshipped the river which flows from the sky.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अवतीर्य रथात् तूर्णं कृत्वा शौचं यथाविधि। रथमोचनमादिश्य संध्यामुपविवेश ह॥
English Translation: Having worshipped her, all the virtuous Pandavas accompanied by the Rishis again cheerfully proceeded.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: दारुकोऽपि हयान् मुक्त्वा परिचर्य च शास्त्रतः। मुमोच सर्वयोक्त्रादि मुक्त्वा चैतानवासृजत्॥
English Translation: Those best of men then saw at a distance some white objects of vast proportions which looked like the Meru (mountain) stretching in all directions.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अभ्यतीत्य तु तत् सर्वमुवाच मधुसूदनः। युधिष्ठिरस्य कार्यार्थमिह वत्स्यामहे क्षपाम्॥
English Translation: Seeing the Pandavas eager to ask him about it, Lomasha, skillful in speech, thus spoke. “Hear, O sons of Pandu.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तस्य तन्मतमाज्ञाय चक्रुरावसथं नराः। क्षणेन चान्नपानानि गुणवन्ति समार्जयन्॥
English Translation: O foremost of men, what you see before you and what is of vast proportions looking like a mountain and appearing as beautiful as the Kailasa, is the collection of bones of the greatly powerful Daitya Naraka. As they have been kept on a mountain one mistakes it for a mountain.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तस्मिन् ग्रामे प्रधानास्तु य आसन् ब्राह्मणा नृप। आर्याः कुलीना ह्रीमन्तो ब्राह्मी वृत्तिमनुष्ठिताः॥
English Translation: In the days of yore, this Daitya was killed by the Supreme Soul, the eternal deity Vishnu, for the good of the king of the celestials.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तेऽभिगम्य महात्मानं हृषीकेशमरिंदमम्। पूजां चक्रुर्यथान्यायमाशीर्मङ्गसंयुताम्॥
English Translation: That high-souled Daitya performed great asceticism for ten thousand years with the desire of getting possession of Indra's kingdom.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: ते पूजयित्वा दाशार्ह सर्वलोकेषु पूजितम्। न्यवेदयन्त वेश्मानि रनवन्ति महात्मने॥
English Translation: That son of Diti, becoming thus unrivalled by the power of his asceticism, as well as, that of arms, always harassed (Indra).
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तान् प्रभुः कृतमित्युक्त्वा सत्कृत्य च यथार्हतः। अभ्येत्य चैषां वेश्मानि पुनरायात् सहैव तैः॥
English Translation: O sinless one, Sakra (Indra) became agitated. Afflicted with fear by learning his prowess, asceticism and observance of religious vows,
---
Sanskrit Shloka: सुमृष्टं भोजयित्वा च ब्राह्मणांस्तत्र केशवः। भुक्त्वा च सह तैः सर्वैरवसत् तां क्षपां सुखम्॥
English Translation: He mentally thought of the eternal deity Vishnu; and the graceful lord of the universe who is present everywhere appeared and stood before him.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: वैशम्पायन उवाच प्रविशन्नर्जुनो राजन्नाश्रमं सत्यवादिनः। ददर्शासीनमेकान्ते मुनि सत्यवतीसुतम्॥
English Translation: The Rishis and the celestials propitiated Vishnu with prayers. In his presence even the exalted and blazing Havyavahana (fire), lost his effulgence. Seeing that giver of boons, the deity Vishnu, the lord of all the celestials,
---
Sanskrit Shloka: स तमासाद्य धर्मज्ञमुपतस्थे महाव्रतम्। अर्जुनोऽस्मीति नामास्मै निवेद्याभ्यवदत् ततः॥
English Translation: The wielder of thunder (Indra) with joined hands and bowed down head, told him soon the cause of his fear.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: स्वागतं तेऽस्त्विति प्राह मुनिः सत्यवतीसुतः। आस्यतामिति होवाच प्रसन्नात्मा महामुनिः॥
English Translation: Vishnu said: “O Sakra, I know your fear originates from the lord of the Daityas, Naraka. By his successful asceticism he desires to obtain Indra's kingdom.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तमप्रतीतमनसं निःश्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः निर्विण्णमनसं दृष्ट्वा पार्थं व्यासोऽब्रवीदिदम्॥ नखकेशदशाकुम्भवारिणा किं समुक्षितः। आवीरजानुगमनं ब्राह्मणो वा हतस्त्वया॥
English Translation: O lord of the celestials, although he has achieved success in asceticism. I shall sever his soul from his body to do you good. Wait for a moment."
---
Sanskrit Shloka: युद्धे पराजितो वासि गतश्रीरिव लक्ष्यसे। न त्वां प्रभिन्नं जानामि किमिदं भरतर्षभ॥ श्रोतव्यं चेन्मया पार्थ क्षिप्रमाख्यातुमर्हसि।
English Translation: Lomasha said: Thereupon the greatly powerful Vishnu deprived him (Naraka) of his senses by striking him with his hands. He (Naraka) the fell down on the ground dead, like a great mountain.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अर्जुन उवाच यः स मेघवपुः श्रीमान् बृहत्पंकजलोचनः॥ स कृष्ण: सह रामेण त्यक्त्वा देहं दिवं गतः। (तद्वाक्यस्पर्शनालोकसुखं त्वमृतसंतिभम्। संस्मृत्य देवदेवस्य प्रमुह्याम्यमृतात्मनः॥) मौसले बृष्णिवीराणां विनाशो ब्रह्मशापजः॥
English Translation: He was thus killed by a miracle and his bones were then gathered at this spot. Here thus is manifest another great deed of Vishnu.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: बभूव वीरान्तकरः प्रभासे लोमहर्षणः। एते शूरा महात्मानः सिंहदर्पा महाबलाः॥
English Translation: Once the whole earth was lost, it sunk into the nether regions. But she was again lifted up by him (Vishnu) who had assumed the form of a boar.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: भोजवृष्ण्यन्धका ब्रह्मन्नन्योन्यं तैर्हतं युधि। गदापरिघशक्तीनां सहाः परिघबाहवः॥ त एरकाभिर्निहताः पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम्। हतं पञ्चशतं तेषां सहस्रं बाहुशालिनाम्॥ निधनं समनुप्राप्तं समासाद्येतरेतरम्।
English Translation: Yudhishthira said: O exalted one, narrate in detail how Vishnu, the lord of the celestials, raised up the earth sunk down one hundred yojanas. How was also that support of all created things, the greatly blessed Earth, who dispenses blessings and produces all sorts of course, made stable? By whom she was forced to sink one hundred yojanas and under what circumstances was this greatest exploit of the Supreme Being exhibited? O foremost of Brahmanas, I desire to hear all this in detail as it happened. You know all about it.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: पुनः पुनर्न मृष्यामि विनाशममितौजसाम्॥ चिन्तयानो यदूनां च कृष्णस्य च यशस्विनः।
English Translation: Lomasha said: O Yudhishthira, hear all in detail as I narrate the story which you have asked me to relate. O child, in the days of yore, in a terrible time in the Treta Yuga the ancient and primeval deity performed the duties of Yama.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: शोषणं सागरस्येव पर्वतस्येव चालनम्॥ नभसः पतनं चैव शैत्यमग्नेस्तथैव च। अश्रद्धेयमहं मन्ये विनाशं शार्ङ्गधन्वनः॥ न चेह स्थातुमिच्छामि लोके कृष्णविनाकृत्।
English Translation: O undeteriorating one, when the god of gods began to perform the duties of Yama, there was no death (on earth), but births were numerous.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: इतः कष्टतरं चान्यच्छृणु तद् वै तपोधन॥ मनो मे दीर्यते येन चिन्तयानस्य वै मुहुः।
English Translation: Birds, beasts, kine, sheep, deer and all kinds of wild animals began to multiply.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: पश्यतो वृष्णिदाराश्च मम ब्रह्मन् सहस्रशः॥ आभीरैरनुसृत्याजौ हताः पञ्चनदालयैः।
English Translation: O foremost of men, O chastiser of foes, men also began to multiply by thousands and tens of thousands like water.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: धनुरादाय तत्राहं नाशकं तस्य पूरणे॥ यथा पुरा च मे वीर्यं भुजयोर्न तथाऽभवत्।
English Translation: O child, by this terrible increase of creatures, the Earth sank down one thousand yojanas.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अस्त्राणि मे प्रनष्टानि विविधानि महामुने॥ शराश्च क्षयमापन्नाः क्षणेनैव समन्ततः।
English Translation: Being afflicted with pain all over her body and being deprived of her senses by this excessive weight (on her), she sought the protection of the foremost of deities NaraNarayana.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: पुरुषश्चाप्रमेयात्मा शंखचक्रगदाधरः॥ चतुर्भुजः पीतवासाः श्यामः पद्मदलेक्षणः। यश्च याति पुरस्तान्मे रथस्य सुमहाद्युतिः॥
English Translation: The Earth said: O exalted deity, it is through your favour I was able to remain so long in my position. But (now) I have been overcome with (a heavy) burden and I am now unable to hold myself any longer.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्रदहन रिपुसैन्यानि न पश्याम्यहमच्युतम्। येन पूर्वं प्रदग्धानि शत्रूसैन्यानि तेजसा॥
English Translation: O exalted deity, you should remove this burden. O deity, O lord, I ask your protection. Extend your favour towards me.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: शरैर्गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तैरहं पश्चाच्च नाशयम्। तमपश्यन् विषीदामि घूर्णामीव च सत्तम॥
English Translation: Lomasha said: Having heard her these words, the eternal deity of six attributes, cheerfully spoke these words to her with great distinctness.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: विना जनार्दनं वीरं नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे॥ श्रुत्वैव हि गतं विष्णुं ममापि मुमुहुर्दिशः।
English Translation: Vishnu said: O Earth, O holder of treasures, O burdened earth, do not be afraid; I shall act in the way by which you will be relieved of your burden.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्रणष्टज्ञातिवीर्यस्य शून्यस्य परिधावतः॥ उपदेष्टुं मम श्रेयो भवानर्हति सत्तम।
English Translation: Lomasha said : Having thus sent away the earth adorned with mountains as her ear-rings, he then became a greatly effulgent boar with one tusk.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: व्यास उवाच ब्रह्मशापविनिर्दग्धा वृष्ण्यन्धकमहारथाः॥ विनष्टाः कुरुशार्दूल न ताशोचितुमर्हसि।
English Translation: Causing terror with his red eyes and ernitting smokes from his blazing lustre, he began to swell in magnitude in that place.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: भवितव्यं तथा तच्च दिष्टमेतन्महात्मनाम्॥ उपेक्षितं च कृष्णेन शक्तेनापि व्यपोहितुम्।
English Translation: O hero, then holding the earth with his single tusk that eternal one raised her up one hundred yojanas.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: त्रैलोक्यमपि गोविन्दः कृत्स्नं स्थावरजङ्गमम्॥ प्रसहेदन्यथाकर्तुं कुतः शापं महात्मनाम्।
English Translation: When she was thus raised up, a great agitation was created. All the celestials the Rishis and the ascetics were agitated; and the earth, the sky and the heaven were filled with “Alas! Oh!". Neither the celestials nor men could find peace.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: रथस्य पुरतो याति यः स चक्रगदाधरः॥ तव स्नेहात् पुराणर्षिर्वासुदेवश्चतुर्भुज।
English Translation: Then the celestials and the Rishis all approached Brahma who was seated as if blazing in his own prosperity.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कृत्वा भरावतरणं पृथिव्याः पृथुलोचनः॥ मोक्षयित्वा तनुं प्राप्तः कृष्णः स्वस्थानमुत्तमम्।
English Translation: Coming to the deity Brahma, the witness of the acts of all beings, they with joined hands thus said to these words.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: त्वयापीह महत् कर्म देवानां पुरुषर्षभ॥ कृतं भीमसहायेन यमाभ्यां च महाभुज।
English Translation: The Celestialss said: "O lord of heaven, all created beings have become agitated; all the mobile and immobile creatures have become restless. The ocean are also in great agitation.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कृतकृत्यांश्च वो मन्ये संसिद्धान् कुरुपुङ्गव॥ गमनं प्राप्तकालं व इहं श्रेयस्कर विभो।
English Translation: This whole earth has gone one hundred yojanas down. What is the cause of all this? By whom the whole universe has been agitated? Kindly explain the cause to us without delay; we are all bewildered.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: एवं बुद्धिश्च तेजश्च प्रतिपत्तिश्च भारता॥ भवन्ति भवकालेषु विपद्यन्ते विपर्यये।
English Translation: Brahma said: O immortals, there is no fear from the Asuras in any matter or in any place. Hear why all this agitation has taken place.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कालमूलमिदं सर्वं जगद्बीजं धनञ्जय॥ काल एव समादत्ते पुनरेव यदृच्छया।
English Translation: This heaven has been agitated from the prowess of the illustrious being, who is omnipresent, eternal and the never-perishing soul.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: स एव बलवान् भूत्वा पुनर्भवति दुर्बलः॥ स एवेशश्च भूत्वेह परैराज्ञाप्यते पुनः।
English Translation: That supreme soul, Vishnu, has lifted up again the earth which sank down one hundred yojanas.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कृतकृत्यानि चास्त्राणि गतान्यद्य यथागतम्॥ पुनरेष्यन्ति ते हस्ते यदा कालो भविष्यति।
English Translation: On account of thus raising her up, this agitation has taken place. Know this to be the cause and dispel your doubts.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कालो गन्तुं गतिं मुख्यां भवतामपि भारत॥ एतच्छ्रेयो हि वो मन्ये परमं भरतर्षभ।
English Translation: The Celestialss said : O exalted deity, where is that God, who so easily raises up the earth? Tell us the place; we shall all go there.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: वैशम्पायन उवाच एतद् वचनमाज्ञाय व्यासस्यामिततेजसः॥ अनुज्ञातो ययौ पार्थो नगरं नागसाह्रयम्।
English Translation: Brahma said: Go there. Be blessed, you will find him in the Nandana. Yonder is the exalted and adored Suparna (Garuda).
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्रविश्य च पुरी वीरः समासाद्य युधिष्ठिरम्। आचष्ट तद् यथावृत्तं वृष्ण्यन्धककुलं प्रति॥
English Translation: After having raised the earth, the Supreme Being, the creator of the world, blazes forth in the form of a boar like consuming fire at the universal dissolution,
---
Sanskrit Shloka: नारद उवाच अशोकं शोकनाशार्थं शास्त्रं शान्तिकरं शिवम्। निशम्य लभते बुद्धिं तां लब्ध्वा सुखमेधते॥
English Translation: On his breast is to be seen (the gem) Srivatsa. Behold all of you that being who does not know deterioration.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: शोकस्थानसहस्राणि भयस्थानशतानि च। दिवसे दिवसे मूढमाविशन्ति न पण्डितम्॥
English Translation: Lomasha said: The immortals, with the Grandsire at their head, after having seen that great soul and heard his praise, went back to the place whence they came.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तस्मादनिष्टनाशार्थमितिहासं निबोध मे। तिष्ठते चेद् वशे बुद्धिर्लभते शोकनाशनम्॥
English Translation: Vaishampayana said : O Janamejya, having heard this story, all the Pandavas with great alacrity proceeded by the way pointed out by Lomasha.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अनिष्टसम्प्रयोगाच्च विप्रयोगात् प्रियस्य च। मनुष्या मानसैर्दुःखैर्युज्यन्ते स्वल्पबुद्धयः॥
English Translation: Shaunaka said: Tell me again in detail all that king Janamejaya asked his ministers to say about his father's ascension to heaven.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: द्रव्येषु समतीतेषु ये गुणास्तान् न चिन्तयेत्। न तानाद्रियमाणस्य स्नेहबन्धः प्रमुच्यते॥
English Translation: Sauti said : O Brahmana, hear all that the king asked his ministers and all that they said about the death of Parikshit.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: दोषदर्शी भवेत् तत्र यत्र रागः प्रवर्तते। अनिष्टवर्धितं पश्येत् तथा क्षिप्र विरज्यते॥
English Translation: Janamejaya said : You know all that happened to my father and how my illustrious father met with his death.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: नार्थो न धर्मो न यशो योऽतीतमनुशोचति। अप्यभावेन युज्येत तच्चास्य न निवर्तते।॥
English Translation: Hearing from you all about my father, I shall do what is proper and good. I shall not do otherwise.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: गुणैर्भूतानि युज्यन्ते वियुज्यन्ते तथैव च। सर्वाणि नैतदेकस्य शोकस्थानं हि विद्यते॥
English Translation: Sauti said : Being asked by that high-souled king Janamejaya, the virtuous and wise ministers thus replied.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: मृतं वा यदि वा नष्टं योऽतीतमनुशोचति। दुःखेन लभते दु:खं द्वावनों प्रपद्यते॥
English Translation: The Ministers said: Hear, O king, what you have asked. Hear an account of that king of the world, your illustrious father's life and how he left this world.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: नाश्रु कुर्वन्ति ये बुद्ध्या दृष्ट्वा लोकेषु संततिम्। सम्यक् प्रपश्यतः सर्वं नाश्रुकर्मोपपद्यते॥
English Translation: Your father was virtuous and noble and a protector of his subjects. Hear, how that highsouled king conducted himself on earth.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: दुःखोपघाते शारीरे मानसे चाप्युपस्थिते। यस्मिन् न शक्यते कर्तुं यत्नस्तन्नानुचिन्तयेत्॥
English Translation: That virtuous king, virtuously inclined, protected, like Virtue and Justice themselves, the four castes, keeping them in the duties of their respective orders.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: भैषज्यमेतद् दुःखस्य यदेतन्नानुचिन्तयेत्। चिन्त्यमानं हि न व्येति भूयश्चापि प्रवर्धते॥
English Translation: Blessed with fortune and with matchless prowess, he protected the goddess earth. He hated none and had none to hate him.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्रज्ञया मानसं दुःखं हन्याच्छारीरमौषधैः। एतद् विज्ञानसामर्थ्य न बालैः समतामियात्॥
English Translation: Like Prajapati he looked at all creatures with equal eyes. The Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras,
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अनित्यं यौवनं रूपं जीवितं द्रव्यसंचयः। आरोग्यं प्रियसंवासो गृध्येत् तत्र न पण्डितः॥
English Translation: Engaged in their respective duties, O king, were all impartially protected by him. He maintained widows, orphans, the maimed and the poor.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: न जानपदिकं दुःखमेकः शोचितुमर्हति। अशोचन् प्रतिकुर्वीत यदि पश्येदुपक्रमम्॥
English Translation: He was handsome and was like a second moon to all creatures. All were contented and blessed with good fortune by that truthful and greatly powerful king.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: सुखाद् बहुतरं दुःखं जीविते नात्र संशयः। स्निग्धत्वं चेन्द्रियार्थेषु मोहान्मरणमप्रियम्॥
English Translation: He was the disciple of Sharadvata in the science of arms. O Janamejaya, your father was the beloved of Govinda (Krishna).
---
Sanskrit Shloka: परित्यजति यो दुःखं सुखं वाप्युभयं नरः। अभ्येति ब्रह्म सोऽत्यन्तं न तं शोचन्ति पण्डिताः।१७।।
English Translation: He was the favourite of all men and was greatly renowned. He was born in the womb of Uttara when the Kuru race was almost destroyed.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: त्यज्यन्ते दुःखमर्था हि पालने न च ते सुखाः। दुःखेन चाधिगम्यते नाशमेषां न चिन्तयेत्॥
English Translation: Therefore the mighty son of Abhimanyu was called Parikshit. He was learned in the treatise on the duties of kings and was adorned with all the noble qualities.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अन्यामन्यां धनावस्थां प्राप्य वैशेषिकी नराः। अतृप्ता यान्ति विध्वंसं संतोषं यान्ति पण्डिता॥
English Translation: He had his passions under control, he was intelligent, he was gifted with great memory, he was the practiser of all virtues, a conqueror of six passions, a great intelligent man, fully acquainted with the science of ethics.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: सर्वे क्षयान्ता निचयाः पतनान्ताः समुच्छ्रयाः। संयोगा विप्रयोगान्ता मरणान्तं हि जीवितम्॥
English Translation: Your father ruled over his subjects for sixty years. When he died, all the people were extremely sorry. After him, O best of men, you have acquired this hereditary kingdom of the Kurus, (who have been ruling over it) for the last thousand years. O protector of every creature, you were installed when you were a child.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अन्तो नास्ति पिपासायास्तुष्टिस्तु परमं सुखम्। तस्मात् संतोषमेवेह धनं पश्यन्ति पण्डिताः॥
English Translation: Janamejaya said : None was born in our dynasty who did not look after the good of his subjects and who was not beloved by them. See specially the conduct of my grandfathers (five Pandava brothers) who were ever engaged in great deeds.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: निमेषमात्रमपि हि वयो गच्छन्न तिष्ठति। स्वशरीरेष्वनित्येषु नित्यं किमनुचिन्तयेत्॥
English Translation: How did my such a noble father meet with his death? Describe it to me. I am desirous of hearing it.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: भूतेषु भावं संचिन्त्य ये बुद्ध्वा मनस: परम्। न शोचन्ति गताध्वानः पश्यन्तः परमां गतिम्॥
English Translation: Sauti said : Thus asked by the king, the ministers, the well-wishers of the king, told him everything as it had happened.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: संचिन्वानकमेवैनं कामानामवितृप्तकम्। व्याघ्रः पशुमिवासाद्य मृत्युरादाय गच्छति।॥
English Translation: The Ministers said: O king, that monarch, the lord of the world, greatly obedient to all Shastras like the first of all beings, became addicted to sports like the best of bow-men, the great warrior and exceedingly powerful Pandu. He made over to us all state affairs.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तथाप्युपायं सम्पश्येद् दुःखस्य परिमोक्षणम्। अशोचन् नारभेच्चैव मुक्तश्चाव्यसनी भवेत्॥
English Translation: Once on a time he went into the forest and pierced a deer with an arrow. Having thus wounded the deer, he followed it armed with sword and quiver into the dense forest,
---
Sanskrit Shloka: शब्दे स्पर्शे च रूपे च गन्धेषु च रसेषु च। नोपभोगात् परं किंचिद् धनिनो वाधनस्य च॥
English Translation: Alone on foot. But he could not, however, come upon that lost deer.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्राक्सम्प्रयोगाद् भूतानां नास्ति दुःखं परायणम्। विप्रयोगात् तु सर्वस्य न शोचेत् प्रकृतिस्थितः॥
English Translation: He, wo was sixty years old and therefore fatigued and hungry, saw a great Rishi in that great forest.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: धृत्या शिश्नोदरं रक्षेत् पाणिपादं च चक्षुषा। चक्षुःश्रोत्रे च मनसा मनो वाचं च विद्यया॥
English Translation: The king accosted that Rishi, who was then observing the vow of silence, but the Rishi did not make any reply.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: प्रणयं प्रतिसंहृत्य संस्तुतेष्वितरेषु च। विचरेदसमुन्नद्धः स सुखी स च पण्डितः॥
English Translation: The fatigued and the hungry king grew angry with the Rishi who sat motionless as a piece of wood in observance of his vow of silence.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अध्यात्मरतिरासीनो निरपेक्षो निरामिषः। आत्मनैव सहायेन यश्चरेत् स सुखी भवेत्॥
English Translation: Knowing not that the Rishi was observing a vow of silence, your father, being angry, insulted him.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: दुर्योधन उवाच वासुदेवो महद् भूतं सर्वलोकेषु कथ्यते। तस्यागमं प्रतिष्ठां च ज्ञातुमिच्छे पितामह॥
English Translation: O excellent one of the Bharata race, he took up from the ground a dead snake with the end of his bow and placed it on the shoulder of that holy Rishi.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: भीष्म उवाच वासुदेवो महद् भूतं सर्वदैवतदैवतम्। न परं पुण्डरीकाक्षाद् दृश्यते भरतर्षभ॥
English Translation: But that wise man did not speak a word, good or bad and he did not become angry. He remained as he was, bearing the snake on his shoulder.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: मार्कण्डेयश्च गोविन्दे कथयत्यद्भुतं महत्। सर्वभूतानि भूतात्मा महात्मा पुरुषोत्तमः॥
English Translation: Sanjaya said While Duryodhana, O king, was repeatedly crying aloud in this way, Vasudeva, worked up with wrath, said to Yudhishthira.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: आपो वायुश्च तेजश्च त्रयमेतदकल्पयत्। स सृष्ट्वा पृथिवीं देवीं सर्वलोकेश्वरः प्रभुः॥
English Translation: What indiscreet words have you given vent to, O king, saying that killing one amongst us be you the king of Kurus. If, indeed, O Yudhishthira, Duryodhana selects you for battle or Arjuna or Nakula or Sahadeva, (what will be the consequence?
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अप्सु वै शयनं चक्रे महात्मा पुरुषोत्तमः। सर्वतेजोमयो देवो योगात् सुष्वाप तत्र ह॥
English Translation: With a view to kill Bhimasena, O king, Duryodhana has practiced with the mace upon a statue of iron.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: मुखतः सोऽग्निमसृजत् प्राणाद् वायुमथापि च। सरस्वती च वेदांश्च मनसः ससृजेऽच्युतः॥
English Translation: How then, O best of Bharata's race will our object be accomplished? From pity, O best of kings, you have acted very indiscreetly.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: एष लोकान् ससर्जादौ देवांश्च ऋषिभिः सह। निधनं चैव मृत्युं च प्राजानां प्रभवाप्ययौ॥
English Translation: I do not at this moment see any match for Duryodhana except Pritha's son Vrikodara. His practice again, with the mace, is not so great.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: एष धर्मश्च धर्मज्ञो वरदः सर्वकामदः। एष कर्ता च कार्यं च पूर्वदेवः स्वयम्प्रभुः॥
English Translation: You have, therefore, once more given preference to a game of chance as that one formerly between yourself and Shakuni, O monarch.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: भूतं भव्यं भविष्यच्च पूर्वमेतदकल्पयत्। उभे संध्ये दिशः खं च नियमांश्च जनार्दनः॥ ऋषींश्चैव हि गोविन्दस्तपश्चैवाभ्यकल्पयत्। स्रष्टारं जगतश्चापि महात्मा प्रभुरव्ययः॥
English Translation: Bhima is endued with might and prowess, King Duryodhana, however, is skillful. In a fight between might and skill, he, that is skillful, O king, always becomes successful.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अग्रजं सर्वभूतानां संकर्षणकल्पयत्। तस्मान्नारायणो जज्ञे देवदेवः सनातनः॥ नाभौ पद्मं बभूवास्य सर्वलोकस्य सम्भवात्। तस्मात् पितामहो जातस्तस्माज्जातास्त्विमाः प्रजाः।१२। शेषं चाकल्पयद् देवमनन्तं विश्वरूपिणम्।
English Translation: Such an enemy, O king, you have, by your words placed in a comfortable and secure position. You have placed your oneself, however, in a difficult position. We have, for this, been placed in great peril.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: यो धारयति भूतानि धरां चेमां सपर्वताम्॥ ध्यानयोगेन विप्राश्च तं विदन्ति महौजसम्।
English Translation: Who is there that would relinquish sovereignty within grasp, after having defeated all his enemy and when he has only one foe to kill who even is sunk in difficulties?
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कर्णस्रोतोभवं चापि मधुं नाम महासुरम्॥ तमुग्रमुग्रकर्माणमुग्रां बुद्धिं समास्थितम्। ब्रह्मणोऽपचितिं कुर्वञ् जघान पुरुषोत्तमः॥ तस्य तात वधादेव देवदानवमानवाः।
English Translation: I do not see such a man in the world today, be he a god, who is able to defeat the macearmed Duryodhana in battle.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: मधुसूदनमित्याहुर्ऋषयश्च जनार्दनम्॥ वराहश्चैव सिंहश्च त्रिविक्रमगतिः प्रभुः।
English Translation: Neither you, nor Bhima, nor Nakula nor Sahadeva, nor Phalguna is capable of defeating Duryodhana in fair fight. King Duryodhana is endued with great skill.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: एष माता पिता चैव सर्वेषां प्राणिनां हरिः॥ परं हि पुण्डरीकाक्षान्न भूतं न भविष्यति।
English Translation: How then, O Bharata, can you address to such a foe words such as these viz.,., "Fight, selecting the mace as the weapon and if you can kill one amongst us, you shall then be the king."
---
Sanskrit Shloka: मुखतः सोऽसृजद् विप्रान् बाहुभ्यां क्षत्रियांस्तथा॥ वैश्यांश्चाप्यूस्तो राजशूद्रान् वै पादतस्तथा।
English Translation: If Duryodhana meets Vrikodara amongst us wishing to fight fairly with him, even then our victory will hang in the balance. Duryodhana is highly powerful and skillful.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तपसा नियतो देवं विधानं सर्वदेहिनाम्॥ ब्रह्मभूतममावास्यां पौर्णमास्यां तथैव च। योगभूतं परिचरन् केशवं महदाप्नुयात्॥ केशवः परमं तेजः सर्वलोकपितामहः।
English Translation: How could you say to him-"Killing only one amongst us be you the king." Forsooth the children of Pandu and Kunti are not destined to enjoy kingdom. They have been born for passing their lives in continued exile in the forest or in mendicancy.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: एनमाहुर्हषीकेशं मुनयो वै नराधिप॥ एवमेनं विजानीहि आचार्यं पितरं गुरुम्।
English Translation: Bhimasena said O killer of Madhu, do not, O delighted of the Yadus, grieve. However difficult it may be, I shall terminate these hostilities.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कृष्णो यस्य प्रसीदेत लोकास्तेनाक्षया जिताः॥ यश्चैवैनं भयस्थाने केशवं शरणं व्रजेत्।
English Translation: Forsooth, I shall kill Suyodhana in battle. It appears, O Krishna, that the victory of righteous Yudhishthira is certain.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: सदा नरः पठंश्चेदं स्वस्तिमान् स सुखी भवेत्॥ ये च कृष्णं प्रपद्यन्ते ते न मुह्यन्ति मानवाः।
English Translation: This mace of mine is heavier by one and a half times than Duryodhana's. Do no, O Madhava, grieve.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: भये महति मग्नांश्च पाति नित्यं जनार्दनः॥ स तं युधिष्ठिरो ज्ञात्वा याथातथ्येन भारत।
English Translation: I dare fight him, selecting the mace as the weapon. Let all of you, O Janarddana, witness this encounter.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: सर्वात्मना महात्मानं केशवं जदीश्वरम्। प्रपन्नः शरणं राजन् योगानां प्रभुमीश्वरम्॥
English Translation: What do you say of Suyodhana, I would fight with the three worlds including the very celestials even if they be armed with every kind of weapon.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: युधिष्ठिर उवाच भीमसेन यमौ चोभौ पाञ्चालि च निबोधत। नास्ति भूतस्य नाशो वै पश्यतास्मान् वनेचरान्॥
English Translation: Sanjaya continued After Vrikodara had said these words, Vasudeva, filled with glee, applauded him highly and said to him-"Depending on you, O you of great arms, the righteous king Yudhishthira will, forsooth, get back his prosperity after the destruction of all his foes.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: दुर्बला: क्लेशिताः स्मेति यद् ब्रुवामेतरेतरम्। अशक्येऽपि व्रजामो यद्धनंजयदिदृक्षया।॥
English Translation: You have slain all the sons of Dhritarashtra in battle. At your hands many kings and princes and elephants have met with their death.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तन्मे दहति गात्राणि तूलराशिमिवानलः। यच्च वीरं न पश्यामिधनंजयमुपान्तिकात्॥
English Translation: The Kalingas, the Magadhas, the Kauravas, the Westerners and the Gandharvas have all been killed in dreadful battles, O son of Pandu.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तस्य दर्शनतृष्णं मां सानुजं वनमास्थितम्। याज्ञसेन्याः परामर्श स च वीर दहत्युत॥
English Translation: Killing Duryodhana then, O son of Kunti, bestow the earth with her oceans upon the righteous Yudhishthira like Vishnu conferring the sovereignty of the three worlds upon the lord of Shachi.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: नकुलात् पूर्वजं पार्थं न पश्याम्यमितौजसम्। अजेयमुग्रधन्वानं तेन तप्ये वृकोदर॥
English Translation: Getting you for a foe in battle, the wretched son of Dhritarashtra, will forsooth meet with his death. You will certainly fulfill your promise by breaking his bones.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तीर्थानि चैव रम्याणि वनानि च सरांसि चा चरामि सह युष्माभिस्तस्य दर्शनकाझया।॥ पञ्चवर्षाण्यहं वीरं सत्यसंधंधनंजयम्। यन्न पश्यामि बीभत्सुं तेन तप्ये वृकोदर॥
English Translation: You should however, O son of Pritha, always fight with care with the son of Dhritarashtra. He is endued with both skill and strength and always finds delight in battle.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तं वै श्यामं गुडाकेशं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम्। न पश्यामि महाबाहुं तेन तप्ये वृकोदर॥
English Translation: Then Satyaki, O king, applauded the son of Pandu.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कृतास्त्रं निपुणं युद्धेऽप्रतिमानधनुष्मताम्। न पश्यामि कुरुश्रेष्ठ तेन तप्ये वृकोदर॥
English Translation: The Panchalas and the Pandavas, also, headed by the righteous king Yudhishthira, all praised Bhimasena.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: चरन्तमरिसंघेषु काले क्रुद्धमिवान्तकम्। प्रभिन्नमिव मातङ्गं सिंहस्कन्धंधनंजयम्॥ यः स शक्रादनवरो वीर्येण द्रविणेन च। यमयोः पूर्वजः पार्थः श्वेताश्वोऽमितविक्रमः॥ दुःखेन महताविष्टस्तं न पश्यामि फाल्गुनम्। अजेयमुग्रधन्वानं तेन तप्ये वृकोदर॥
English Translation: Then Bhima, of terrible might, addressed Yudhishthira who was standing amid the Srinjayas like the burning Sun himself, saying-"I venture to fight with this man in battle. This wretch among men is not able to defeat me in fight.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: सततं यः क्षमाशीलः क्षिप्यमाणोऽप्यणीयसा। ऋजुमार्गप्रपन्नस्य शर्मदाताभयस्य च॥
English Translation: Today I shall vomit that ire which has been ranking in my bosom against Suyodhana the son of Dhritarashtra like Arjuna throwing fire on the forest of Khandava.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: स तु जिह्मप्रवृत्तस्य माययाभिजिघांसतः। अपि वज्रधरस्यापि भवेत् कालविषोपमः॥
English Translation: I shall today pluck out the dart, O son of Pandu, that lay so long sticking to your heart. Be happy, O king, after I shall have struck down this wretch with my mace.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: शत्रोरपि प्रपन्नस्य सोऽनृशंसः प्रतापवान्। दाताभयस्य बीभत्सुरमितात्मा महाबलः॥
English Translation: Today I shall recover, O sinless one, your garland of glory. Today Suyodhana shall renounce his life, his prosperity and his kingdom.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: सर्वेषामाश्रयोऽस्माकं रणेऽरीणां प्रमर्दिता। आहर्ता सर्वरत्नानां सर्वेषां नः सुखावहः॥
English Translation: Today hearing of his son's death, king Dhritarashtra will remember all those wrongs that he did to us under Shakuni's advice."
---
Sanskrit Shloka: रत्नानि यस्य वीर्येण दिव्यान्यासन् पुरा मम। बहूनि बहुजातीनि यानि प्राप्तः सुयोधनः॥
English Translation: Having said these words, that energetic prince, of Bharata's race, stood up for battle, like Shakra summoning Vritra to an encounter.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: यस्य बाहुबलाद् वीर सभा चासीत् पुरा मम। सर्वरत्नमयी ख्याता त्रिषु लोकेषु पाण्डव॥
English Translation: Unable to endure that call your highly energetic son, proceeded to the encounter, like one infuriate elephant proceeding to assail another.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: वासुदेवसमं वीर्ये कार्तवीर्यसमं युधि। अजेयममितं युद्धे तं न पश्यामि फाल्गुनम्॥
English Translation: The Pandavas saw your son, as he came armed with mace, as the summit of the mount Kailasa.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: संकर्षणं महावीर्यं त्वां च भीमापराजितम्। अनुयातः स्ववीर्येण वासुदेवं च शत्रुहा।॥
English Translation: Verily beholding that powerful son of yours standing alone like a prince of elephants separated from the herd, the Pandavas were filled with joy.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: यस्य बाहुबले तुल्यः प्रभावे च पुरंदरः। जवे वायुर्मुखे सोमः क्रोधे मृत्युः सनातनः॥
English Translation: Standing in battle like a very lion, Duryodhana had no fear, no pain, no anxiety.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: ते वयं तं नरव्याघ्रं सर्वे वीर दिदृक्षवः। प्रवेक्ष्यामो महाबाहो पर्वतं गन्धमादनम्॥
English Translation: Seeing him stand there with uplifted mace like the created mountain of Kailasa, Bhimasena, O monarch, addressed him, saying "Remember all those wrongs that king Dhritarashtra and yourself have inflicted on us. Remember what took place at Varanavata.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: विशाला बदरी यत्र नरनारायणाश्रमः। तं सदाध्युषितं यःक्ष्यामो गिरिमुत्तमम्॥
English Translation: Remember how Draupadi, while in her season, was maltreated in the midst of the assembly and how king Yudhishthira was defeated at dice through Shakuni's advice.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: कुबेरनलिनी रम्यां राक्षसैरभिसेविताम्। पद्भिरेव गमिष्यामस्तप्यमाना महत् तपः॥
English Translation: See now, O wicked man, the dreadful consequence of those acts as also of the other wrongs that you inflicted on the innocent Parthas.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: न च यानवता शक्यो गन्तुं देशो वृकोदर। न नृशंसेन लुब्धेन नाप्रशान्तेन भारत॥
English Translation: It is for you that, that illustrious chief of the Bharatas, the son of Ganga, the grandfather of us all, lies now on a bed of arrows.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तत्र सर्वे गमिष्यामो भीमार्जुनगवेषिणः। सायुधा बद्धनिस्त्रिंशाः सार्धं विप्रैर्महाव्रतैः॥
English Translation: Drona also has been killed. Karna has been killed. Shalya of great valour has been killed. Yonder Shakuni also, the root of these enunities, has been killed in battle.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: मक्षिकादंशमशकान् सिंहान् व्याघ्रान् सरीसृपान्। प्राप्नोत्यनियतः पार्थ नियतस्तान् न पश्यति॥
English Translation: Your heroic brothers and sons, with all your troops, have been killed. Other heroic kings also, who never retreated from battle, have been killed.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: ते वयं नियतात्मानः पर्वतं गन्धमादनम्। प्रवेक्ष्यामो मिताहाराधनंजयदिदृक्षवः॥
English Translation: These and many other leading Kshatriyas, as also Pratikamin, that wretch who had seized the locks of Draupadi, have been killed.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: युधिष्ठिर उवाच न वै निगुणमात्मानं मन्ये देवर्षिसत्तम। तथास्मि दुःखसंतप्तो यथा नान्यो महीपतिः॥
English Translation: You alone are still alive, O destroyer of your family, O wretch among men. I shall forsooth kill you today with my mace.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: परांश्च निर्गुणान् मन्ये न चधर्मगतानपि। ते च लोमश लोकेऽस्मिन्नृध्यन्ते केन हेतुना॥
English Translation: Today, O king, I shall, in battle, repress all your pride. I shall destroy also your hope of sovereignty, O king and pay off all your misdeeds to the sons of Pandu.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: लोमश उवाच नात्र दुःखं त्वया राजन् कार्यं पार्थ कथंचन। यदधर्मेण वर्धेयुरधर्मरुचयो जनाः॥
English Translation: Duryodhana said What is the use of speaking too much? Fight now with me. Today O Vrikodara, I shall subdue you desire for battle.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: वर्धत्यधर्मेण नरस्ततो भद्राणि पश्यति। ततः सपत्नाञ्जयति समूलस्तु विनश्यति॥
English Translation: Why do you not see me, O wretch, standing here for an encounter with the mace? Am I not armed with a formidable mace that looks like a summit of Himavat?
---
Sanskrit Shloka: मया हि दृष्टा दैतेया दानवाश्च महीपते। वर्धमाना ह्यधर्मेण क्षयं चोपगताः पुनः॥
English Translation: What enemy is there, O wretch, that would dare defeat me armed with this weapon? If it be a fair fight, Purandara himself, amongst the celestials, is not capable of doing it.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: पुरा देवयुगे चैव हृष्टं सर्वं मया विभो। अरोचयन् सुराधर्मधर्म तत्यजिरेऽसुराः॥
English Translation: Do not, O son of Kunti, roar uselessly in this way like autumnal clouds shorn of water. Display all the strength you posses in battle now.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तीर्थानि देवा विविशु विशन् भारतासुराः। तानधर्मकृतो दर्पः पूर्वमेव समाविशत्॥
English Translation: Hearing those words of his, the Pandavas with the Srinjayas, all filled with desire of victory, praised them highly.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: दर्पान्मानः समभवन्मानात् क्रोधो व्यजायत। क्रोधादह्रीस्ततोऽलज्जा वृत्तं तेषां ततोऽनशत्॥
English Translation: Like men exciting an infuriate elephant with the clapping of hands, all of them then pleased king Duryodhana.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तानलज्जान् गतह्रीकान् हीनवृत्तान् वृथाव्रतान्। क्षमा लक्ष्मीः स्वधर्मश्च न चिरात् प्रजहुस्ततः॥
English Translation: The elephants began to grunt and the horses to neigh repeatedly. The weapons of the Pandavas who were filled with the desire of victory shone there. The elephants began to grunt and the horses to neigh repeatedly. The weapons of the Pandavas who were filled with the desire of victory shone there.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: लक्ष्मीस्तु देवानगमदलक्ष्मीरसुरान् नृप। तानलक्ष्मी समाविष्टान् दर्पोपहतचेतसः॥
English Translation: Vaishampayana said : Having heard these words of his brothers and Krishna (Draupadi) who were all anxious for Dhananjaya, Dharmaraja became absentminded.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: दैतेयान् दानवांश्चैव कलिरप्याविशत् ततः। तानलक्ष्मीसमाविष्टान् दानवान् कलिना हतान्॥
English Translation: (At that time) he saw (before him) .ne celestials Rishi Narada, blazing with Brahma effulgence and resembling a fire flaming up for the sacrifice.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: दभिभूतान् कौन्तेय क्रियाहीनानचेतसः। मानाभिभूतानचिराद् विनाशः समपद्यत॥
English Translation: Seeing him arrived, Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira) with his brothers and stoop up and duly worshipped the illustrious one.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: निर्यशस्कास्तथा दैत्याः कृत्स्नशो विलयं गताः। देवास्तु सागरांश्चैव सरितश्च सरांसि च॥ अभ्यगच्छन्धर्मशीला: पुण्यान्यायतनानि च। तपोभिः क्रतुभिर्दानैराशीर्वादैश्च पाण्डव॥ प्रजहुः सर्वपापानि श्रेयश्च प्रतिपेदिरे। एवमादानवन्तश्च निरादानाश्च सर्वशः॥
English Translation: Endued with blazing effulgence the handsome chief of the Kurus, surrounded by his brothers, shone like Shatakratu (Indra) surrounded by the celestials.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तीर्थान्यगच्छन् विबुधास्तेनापुभूतिमुत्तमाम्। तथा त्वमपि राजेन्द्र स्नात्वा तीर्थेषु सानुजः॥ पुनर्वेत्स्यसि तां लक्ष्मीमेष पन्थाः सनातनः।
English Translation: In obedience to the dictates of Dharma Yajnaseni (Draupadi) did not abandon the sons of Pritha and is adhered to her husband, as to Savitri to the Vedas or the rays of the sun to the Meru (mountain).

Sanskrit Shloka: यथेव हि नृगो राजा शिबिरौशीनरो यथा॥ भगीरथो वसुमना गयः पूरुः पुरूरवाः। चरमाणास्तपो नित्यं स्पर्शनादम्भसश्च ते॥ तीर्थाभिगमनात् पूता दर्शनाच्च महात्मनाम्। अलभन्त यशः पुण्यंधनानि च विशाम्पते॥
English Translation: O sinless one, having received their worship, the exalted Rishi Narada comforted the son of Dharma (Yudhishthira) in proper words.

Sanskrit Shloka: तथा त्वमपि राजेन्द्र लब्धासि विपुलां श्रियन्त। यथा चेक्ष्वाकुरभवत् सपुत्रजनबान्धवः॥ मुचुकुन्दोऽथ मान्धाता मरुत्तश्च महीपतिः। कीर्ति पुण्यामविन्दन्त यथा देवास्तपोबलात्॥ देवर्षयश्च कात्स्न्येन तथा त्वमपि वेत्स्यसि। धार्तराष्ट्रास्त्वधर्मेण मोहेन च वशीकृताः। न चिराद् वै विनइक्ष्यन्ति दैत्या इव न संशयः॥
English Translation: He thus spoke the high-souled Dharmaraja Yudhishthira, “O foremost of virtuous men, tell me what you seek and what I can give you."

Sanskrit Shloka: भीष्म उवाच प्रोक्ता गृहस्थवृत्तिस्ते विहिता या मनीषिभिः। तदनन्तरमुक्तं यत् तन्निबोध युधिष्ठिर॥
English Translation: Then the son of , the king (Yudhishthira), bowing (to the Rishi) with his brothers, thus spoke with joined hands to Narada, the revered of the celestials.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: क्रमशस्त्ववधूयैनां तृतीयां वृत्तिमुत्तमाम्। संयोगव्रतखिन्नानां वानप्रस्थाश्रमौकसाम्॥
English Translation: Yudhishthira said: O highly exalted one, O worshipped of all the worlds, O Rishi of excellent vows, when you are pleased with me, I consider that all my wishes are gratificd through your grace.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: श्रूयतां पुत्र भद्रं ते सर्वलोकाश्रमात्मनाम्। प्रेक्षापूर्वं प्रवृत्तानां पुण्यदेशनिवासिनाम्॥
English Translation: O sinless one, O foremost of Rishis, I and my brothers deserve (to receive) your favours. You ought to dispel my doubt.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: व्यास उवाच गृहस्थस्तु यदा पश्येद् वलीपलितमात्मनः। अपत्यस्यैव चापत्यं वनमेव तदा श्रयेत्॥
English Translation: You should tell me in detail what merit is obtained by him who travels over the world with the desire of seeing the Tirthas and sacred shrines.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: तृतीयमायुषो भागं वानप्रस्थाश्रमे वसेत्। तानेवाग्नीन् परिचरेद् यजमानो दिवौकसः॥
English Translation: Narada said: O king, hear with attention what was heard by the intelligent Bhishma from Paulastya. Hear all that in detail.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: नियतो नियताहारः षष्ठभुक्तोऽप्रमत्तवान्। तदग्निहोत्रं ता गावो यज्ञाङ्गानि च सर्वशः॥
English Translation: Formerly that foremost of virtuous men Bhishma, when observing the Pitrya vow, lived on the banks of the Bhagirathi with the Rishis. ---
Sanskrit Shloka: अफालकृष्टं व्रीहियवं नीवारं विघसानि च। हींषि सम्प्रयच्छेत मखेष्वत्रापि पञ्चसु॥
English Translation: That greatly effulgent hero (Bhishma) gratified the Pitris, the celestials and the Rishis with offering oblations to them according to the rites ordained in the Shastras.

Sanskrit Shloka: वानप्रस्थाश्रमेऽप्येताश्चतस्रो वृत्तयः स्मृताः। सद्य:प्रक्षालकाः केचित् केचिन्मासिकसंचयाः॥
English Translation: One day when the greatly illustrious one was thus engaged (in observing his vow), he saw that foremost of Rishis, Pulastya of wonderful appearance.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: वार्षिकं संचयं केचित् केचिद् द्वादशवार्षिकम्। कुर्वन्त्यतिथिपूजार्थं यज्ञतन्त्रार्थमेव वा॥
English Translation: Seeing that austere ascetic, as if blazing with prosperity, he became exceedingly glad and was filled with great wonder.

Sanskrit Shloka: अभ्रावकाशा वर्षासु हेमन्ते जलसंश्रयाः। ग्रीष्मे च पञ्च तपसः शश्वच्च मितभोजनाः॥
English Translation: O descendant of Bharata, then that foremost of virtuous men, Bhishma, worshipped according to the rites of the ordinance that highly exalted Rishi who had already arrived.

Sanskrit Shloka: भूमौ विपरिवर्तन्ते तिष्ठन्ति प्रपदैरपि। स्थानासनैर्वर्तयन्ति सवनेष्वभिषिञ्चते॥
English Translation: Purifying himself and making his mind exceedingly attentive and also taking the Arghya on his head, he loudly uttered his name near that foremost of Rishis.

Sanskrit Shloka: दन्तोलूखलिकाः केचिदश्मकुट्टास्तथा परे। शुक्लपक्षे पिबन्त्येके यवागू क्वथितां सकृत्॥
English Translation: O Rishi of excellent vows, be blessed; I am Bhishma, your servant. At the very sight of yours I am cleansed of all my sins.

Sanskrit Shloka: कृष्णपक्षे पिबन्त्यन्ये भुजते वा यथागतम्। मूलैरेके फलैरेके युष्पैरेके दृढव्रताः॥ वर्तयन्ति यथान्यायं वैखानसगतिं श्रिताः।
English Translation: O great king, O Yudhishthira, having said this, that foremost of virtuous men, Bhishma restraining his speech, stood (before the Rishi) in silence and with joined hands.

Sanskrit Shloka: एताश्चान्याश्च विविधा दीक्षास्तेषां मनीषिणाम्॥ चतुर्थश्चौपनिषदो धर्म: साधारणः स्मृतः। वानप्रस्थाद् गृहस्थाच्च ततोऽन्यः सम्प्रवर्तते॥
English Translation: Seeing that foremost of the Kuru race, Bhishma, rendered emaciated by the observance of vows and the study of the Vedas, the Rishi became exceedingly pleased.
---
Sanskrit Shloka: अस्मिन्नेव युगे तात विप्रैः सर्वार्थदर्शिभिः। अगस्त्यः सप्त ऋषयो मधुच्छन्दोऽघमर्षणः॥ सांकृतिः सुदिवा तण्डियथावासोऽकृतश्रमः। अहोवीर्यस्तथा काव्यस्ताण्ड्यो मेधातिथिर्बुधः॥ बलवान् कर्णनिर्वाक: शून्यपालः कृतश्रमः। एनं धर्म कृतवन्तस्ततः स्वर्गमुपागमन॥
English Translation: Galava said This lord, the king of the Kashis, is a ruler of the earth endued with great prowess, and this ruler of men is a descendant of Bhimasena and is known as Divodasa.

Sanskrit Shloka: तात प्रत्यक्षधर्माणस्तथा यायावरा गणाः। ऋषीणामुग्रतपसां धर्मनैपुणदर्शिनाम्॥ अन्ये चापरिमेयाश्च ब्राह्मणा वनमाश्रिताः। वैखानसा वालखिल्याः सैकताश्च तथा परे॥ कर्मभिस्ते निरानन्दा धर्मनित्या जितेन्द्रियाः। गताः प्रत्यक्षधर्माणस्ते सर्वे वनमाश्रिताः॥
English Translation: There shall I go, gentle lady; follow me with show steps and grieve not, for that ruler of men is virtuous, and ever attached to selfcontrol and truth,

Sanskrit Shloka: अनक्षत्रास्त्वनाधृष्या दृश्यन्ते ज्योतिषां गणाः। जरया च परिधनो व्याधिना च प्रपीडितः॥ चतुर्थे चायुषः शेषे वानप्रस्थाश्रमं त्यजेत्। सद्यस्कारां निरूप्येष्टिं सर्व वेदसदक्षिणाम्॥ आत्मयाजी सोऽऽत्मरतिरात्मक्रीडात्मसंश्रयः। आत्मन्यग्नीन् समारोप्य त्यक्त्वा सर्वपरिग्रहान्॥
English Translation: Narada said The ascetic to him was received with becoming honours and Galava urged that king to beget children.

Sanskrit Shloka: साधरकांश्च यजेद् यज्ञानिष्टीश्चैवेह सर्वदा। यदैव याजिनां यज्ञादात्मनीज्या प्रवर्तते।॥ त्रींश्चैवाग्नीन् यजेत् सम्यगात्मन्येवात्ममोक्षणात्। प्राणेभ्यो यजुषः पञ्च षट् प्राश्नीयादकुत्सयन्॥
English Translation: Divodasa said I have heard of all this already; what is the necessity of repeating all this in detail. As soon as I heard of this, O best among the twice-born, this object (children) was desired for by me.

Sanskrit Shloka: केशलोमनखान् वाप्य वानप्रस्थो मुनिस्ततः। आश्रमादाश्रमं पुण्यं पूतो गच्छति कर्मभिः॥
English Translation: This too is a mark of great respect for me that passing by many rulers of men you have come to me and without doubt this will be (i.e. your wishes shall be gratified.)

Sanskrit Shloka: अभयं सर्वभूतेभ्यो दत्त्वा यः प्रव्रजेद् द्विजः। लोकास्तेजोमयास्तस्य प्रेत्य चानन्त्यमश्नुते॥

Sanskrit Shloka: केशपक्षे परामृष्टा पापेन हतबुद्धिना। यदा दुःशासनेनैषा तदा मुह्याम्यहं नृपाः॥

Sanskrit Shloka: युष्मत्तेजोविवृद्ध्यर्थं मया हुद्धर्षणं कृतम्। तदानीं विदुलावाक्यैरिति तद् वित्त पुत्रकाः॥

Sanskrit Shloka: कथं न राजवंशोऽयं नश्येत् प्राप्य सुतान् मम्। पाण्डोरिति मया पुत्रास्तस्मादुद्धर्षणं कृतम्॥
English Translation: Polished like pure gold, the greatest of all weapons this is the greatest of all weapons this is the great weapon of Arjuna, Gandiva.

Sanskrit Shloka: न तस्य पुत्राः पौत्रा वा क्षतवंशस्य पार्थिव।। लभन्ते सुकृताँल्लोकान् यस्माद् वंशः प्रणश्यति।।१६।
English Translation: It is equal to a hundred thousand bows and capable of extending kingdoms: by this Partha defeated in battle celestials and men.

Sanskrit Shloka: भुक्तं राज्यफलं पुत्रा भर्तुर्मे विपुलं पुरा। महादानानि दत्तानि पीतः सोमो यथाविधि॥
English Translation: Adored repeatedly by the celestials, demons and Gandharvas, and variegated with excellent colours, the huge and smooth bow is .without any stain or knot.

Sanskrit Shloka: नाहमात्मफलार्थं वै वासुदेवमचूचुदम्। विदुलायाः प्रलापैस्तैः पालनार्थं च तत् कृतम्॥
English Translation: Brahma held it first for a thousand years and thereafter Prajapati held it for five hundred and three years. Afterwards Shakra did it for five and eighty years. Soma did it for five hundred years and Varuna for a hundred.
